titleInfo.title: RUNAWAY committed to the Jail of Rapides Parish

subject.geographic: Mississippi River 100 miles above New Orleans

mods.abstract: RUNAWAY committed to the Jail of Rapides Parish on 30th January, 1860, a certain negro boy, black, 4 feet 10 inches high, 28 or 30 years old, small and lightly built weighing about 125 or 130 pounds; wears a very small ring on his finger. He says his name is BILL, that he belongs to Joshua Jenkins, on the Mississippi River about 100 miles above New Orleans; that he Ranaway about the middle of the Sugar gringding season. Said boy had in his possession when taken up free papers, and told different stories. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, or he will be dealt with as the law directs. ISRAEL GOREE, Jailor. Feb 1-tf.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
